channel.title: Okay this is anoying
channel.description: recently I raged quitted and mashed every key on my keyboard.. and now like the keys are functioned different.. like "m" will minimize, and q will open c drive.. crap like that. It's not broken.. just I don't know how to permanently turn this function toggle off.. I can turn if off with crt+shift, but after about 10-15 minutes it just reverts.. I kind of need help a.s.a.p... and yeah I've done quite a bit of google searching.. only telling me how to toggle it off..but comes back quickly..

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @OmgItsShane Shane
item.description:
@OmgItsShane wrote:

gf keyboard

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Davidi2:

I love doing things like this, I once accidentally deleted my entire projects folder by mashing keys (thank god for trash bins :P)

I have my recycle bin, on auto delete when deleted… -.-
Great thing I’ve never done, that

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:22, topic:403340”]You are seriously stupid… You’ve obviously physically mashed some buttons so hard that they are being permanently pressed. From what I’ve read it could be the windows key, possibly ctrl. Just buy another keyboard, you can get one for dirt cheap.[/quote]Lol dude, firstly Dont call me stupid, because I actually didn’t even physically damage them, or hit them, i just pressed every single button. And as you can see, my keyboard is completely fine with typing letters, but if I am idle for 10 minutes it reverts to functioning the keys for ease of excess, how I toggle this off? with the crt+shift, but it only last until I’m not active for 10 minutes on the keyboard.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You are seriously stupid… You’ve obviously physically mashed some buttons so hard that they are being permanently pressed. From what I’ve read it could be the windows key, possibly ctrl. Just buy another keyboard, you can get one for dirt cheap.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:19, topic:403340”]Well if its a desktop you can always try switching the port the keyboard is plugged into. It should reinstall the drivers to that port so you shouldn’t have any problem.[/quote]well… My computer is wireless keyboard & mouse… but yeah I did pull out the bluetooth usb, and plugged it back in, sadly didn’t help.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:20, topic:403340”]I love doing things like this, I once accidentally deleted my entire projects folder by mashing keys (thank god for trash bins :P)[/quote]Haha, reason I mashed is because my freaking screen is having seizures lately… it keeps turning on & off repeatably about 100 times… then it stops…

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Well if its a desktop you can always try switching the port the keyboard is plugged into. It should reinstall the drivers to that port so you shouldn’t have any problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:17, topic:403340”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659595#msg3659595 date=1310263539]

[quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659587#msg3659587 date=1310263331]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659576#msg3659576 date=1310263056]

[quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659571#msg3659571 date=1310262806]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659562#msg3659562 date=1310262510]
Did you try rebooting your PC?
[/quote]Tried that before impossible to log into my account… because typing my password is stuffed up from the keys
[/quote]I’m sorry but I can’t do much with knowing that you raged, I need more in-depth information, and I need to know what you already have tried.
[/quote]I didn’t smash the keys or anything… just I know I’ve done some sort of button combination which has triggered it. On start up it is now set to a weird function key setup… make sense like “m” minimizing and other keys opening windows quickly… only way to turn it off is ctr+shift, but that doesn’t last long… pressing “w” in the browser when it is set to the strange key setup, it will cause it to open most tabs possible in the browser.
[/quote]Ah there is the answer, control-shift, control shift is pressed when you want to change you keyboard language settings automaticly, you must’ve added a keyboard language that works like a shortcut.

Here’s the fix,

hit start, type change keyboards or other input methods then click change keyboards, then add the US keyboard, set it as default, and remove everything else in there
[/quote]Hmm strange it was already set to that. :([/quote]get teamviewer, pm me your id and pass oh wait, it was alt+shift, let me do some research, forget the teamviewer.

I did a quick, google search, didn’t find anything, I’m kindoff busy right now, sorry, but I’d say, google control shift problem and do some research, evantually you’ll find what you’re looking for, again sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:16, topic:403340”][quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659587#msg3659587 date=1310263331]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659576#msg3659576 date=1310263056]

[quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659571#msg3659571 date=1310262806]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659562#msg3659562 date=1310262510]
Did you try rebooting your PC?
[/quote]Tried that before impossible to log into my account… because typing my password is stuffed up from the keys
[/quote]I’m sorry but I can’t do much with knowing that you raged, I need more in-depth information, and I need to know what you already have tried.
[/quote]I didn’t smash the keys or anything… just I know I’ve done some sort of button combination which has triggered it. On start up it is now set to a weird function key setup… make sense like “m” minimizing and other keys opening windows quickly… only way to turn it off is ctr+shift, but that doesn’t last long… pressing “w” in the browser when it is set to the strange key setup, it will cause it to open most tabs possible in the browser.
[/quote]Ah there is the answer, control-shift, control shift is pressed when you want to change you keyboard language settings automaticly, you must’ve added a keyboard language that works like a shortcut.

Here’s the fix,

hit start, type change keyboards or other input methods then click change keyboards, then add the US keyboard, set it as default, and remove everything else in there[/quote]Hmm strange it was already set to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:15, topic:403340”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659576#msg3659576 date=1310263056]

[quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659571#msg3659571 date=1310262806]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659562#msg3659562 date=1310262510]
Did you try rebooting your PC?
[/quote]Tried that before impossible to log into my account… because typing my password is stuffed up from the keys
[/quote]I’m sorry but I can’t do much with knowing that you raged, I need more in-depth information, and I need to know what you already have tried.
[/quote]I didn’t smash the keys or anything… just I know I’ve done some sort of button combination which has triggered it. On start up it is now set to a weird function key setup… make sense like “m” minimizing and other keys opening windows quickly… only way to turn it off is ctr+shift, but that doesn’t last long… pressing “w” in the browser when it is set to the strange key setup, it will cause it to open most tabs possible in the browser.[/quote]Ah there is the answer, control-shift, control shift is pressed when you want to change you keyboard language settings automaticly, you must’ve added a keyboard language that works like a shortcut.

Here’s the fix,

hit start, type change keyboards or other input methods then click change keyboards, then add the US keyboard, set it as default, and remove everything else in there

Read full topic

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:14, topic:403340”][quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=500398.msg3659571#msg3659571 date=1310262806]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=500398.msg3659562#msg3659562 date=1310262510]
Did you try rebooting your PC?
[/quote]Tried that before impossible to log into my account… because typing my password is stuffed up from the keys
[/quote]I’m sorry but I can’t do much with knowing that you raged, I need more in-depth information, and I need to know what you already have tried.[/quote]I didn’t smash the keys or anything… just I know I’ve done some sort of button combination which has triggered it. On start up it is now set to a weird function key setup… make sense like “m” minimizing and other keys opening windows quickly… only way to turn it off is ctr+shift, but that doesn’t last long… pressing “w” in the browser when it is set to the strange key setup, it will cause it to open most tabs possible in the browser.

item.title: Okay this is anoying
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

recently I raged quitted and mashed every key on my keyboard… and now like the keys are functioned different… like “m” will minimize, and q will open c drive… crap like that. It’s not broken… just I don’t know how to permanently turn this function toggle off… I can turn if off with crt+shift, but after about 10-15 minutes it just reverts… I kind of need help a.s.a.p… and yeah I’ve done quite a bit of google searching… only telling me how to toggle it off…but comes back quickly…

Read full topic
